javadoc:
The Metadata stream is giant and complicated.  It is made up of {@link CliAbstractTable}s.
@see CliTypeTable

methods.javadoc:
Gets the name of this stream.
@return The name of this stream.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Gets the name of this stream.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: header
params.comment: The stream header associated with this stream.

params.name: fileOffset
params.comment: The file offset where this stream starts.

params.name: rva
params.comment: The relative virtual address where this stream starts.

params.name: reader
params.comment: A reader that is set to the start of the stream.

throws.comment: if there is a problem reading the stream.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the GUID stream.
@return The GUID stream.  Could be null if one doesn't exist.
methods.name: getGuidStream

return.comment: The GUID stream.  Could be null if one doesn't exist.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the user strings stream.
@return The user strings stream.  Could be null if one doesn't exist.
methods.name: getUserStringsStream

return.comment: The user strings stream.  Could be null if one doesn't exist.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the strings stream.
@return The strings stream.  Could be null if one doesn't exist.
methods.name: getStringsStream

return.comment: The strings stream.  Could be null if one doesn't exist.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the blob stream.
@return The blob stream.  Could be null if one doesn't exist.
methods.name: getBlobStream

return.comment: The blob stream.  Could be null if one doesn't exist.

methods.name: createTableObject
methods.comment:
Creates a new CliAbstractTable from the table at the current reader index
 with the given table type.

params.name: tableType
params.comment: The type of table to create.

throws.comment: if there was an issue reading the new table.

return.comment: A new table with the given type.  Could be null if we don't support the table type.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the major version.
@return The major version.
methods.name: getMajorVersion

methods.javadoc:
Gets the minor version.
@return The minor version.
methods.name: getMinorVersion

methods.javadoc:
Gets the sorted field.
@return The sorted field.
methods.name: getSorted

methods.javadoc:
Gets the valid field.
@return The valid field.
methods.name: getValid
getTable
methods.comment: Gets the table with the provided table type from the metadata stream.

params.name: tableType
params.comment: The type of table to get.

return.comment: The table with the provided table type.  Could be null if it doesn't exist.

methods.name: getTable
methods.comment: Gets the table with the provided table type id from the metadata stream.

params.name: tableId
params.comment: The id of the table type to get.

return.comment: The table with the provided table id.  Could be null if it doesn't exist.

methods.name: getNumberRowsForTable
methods.comment: Gets the number of rows in the table with the given table type.

params.name: tableType
params.comment: The type of table to get the number of rows of.

return.comment:
The number of rows in the table with the given table type.  Could be 0 if 
   the table of the given type was not found.

methods.name: getStringIndexDataType
methods.comment:
Gets the data type of the index into the string stream.  Will be either
 DWordDataType or WordDataType.

return.comment: The data type of the index into the string stream.

methods.name: getGuidIndexDataType
methods.comment:
Gets the data type of the index into the GUID stream.  Will be either
 DWordDataType or WordDataType.

return.comment: The data type of the index into the string stream.

methods.name: getBlobIndexDataType
methods.comment:
Gets the data type of the index into the Blob stream.  Will be either
 DWordDataType or WordDataType.

return.comment: The data type of the index into the string stream.

methods.name: getTableIndexDataType
methods.comment:
Gets the data type of the index into a metadata table.  Will be either
 DWordDataType or WordDataType.

return.comment: The data type of the index into the string stream.

name: CliStreamMetadata
comment: The Metadata stream is giant and complicated.  It is made up of CliAbstractTables.
